chapter.p: 1The oracle of the valley of vision:
What business do you have goingLiterally “What to you then that you have gone” up, all of you, to the roofs,

ul.li1: 2noisy,Literally “full of noises” tumultuous city,
ul.li2: exultant town?
ul.li1: Your slain are not slain by the sword,
ul.li2: nor are they dead from battle.
ul.li1: 3All of your rulers have fled together without a bow;
ul.li2: all of you who were foundLiterally “your found ones” were captured.
ul.li1: They were captured together;
ul.li2: they had fled far away.

ul.li1: “Look away from me,
ul.li2: let me weep bitterly;Literally “be bitter in weeping”
ul.li1: you must not insist on comforting me
ul.li2: for the destruction of the daughter of my people.”
ul.li1: 5For the Lord Yahweh of hosts has a day of tumult and trampling and confusionThese three Hebrew words are alliterative: mehûmâûmeḇûsâûmeḇûḵâ in the valley of vision,
ul.li2: a tearing down of wallsHebrew “wall” and a cry for help to the mountains.Hebrew “mountain”
ul.li1: 6And Elam lifted up the quiver,
ul.li3: with chariotsHebrew “chariot” of menHebrew “man” and cavalry.
ul.li2: And Kir uncovered the shield.

ul.li1: the choicest of your valleys were full of chariots,Hebrew “chariot”
ul.li2: and the cavalry confidently stood at the gate.
ul.li3: 8And he uncovered the covering of Judah.
ul.li1: And you looked, on that day, to the weaponsHebrew “weapon” of the House of the Forest,
ul.li2: 9and you saw that the breaches in the walls of the city of David were many,
ul.li3: and you gathered the waters of the lower pool.
ul.li1: 10And you counted the houses of Jerusalem,
ul.li2: and you broke down the houses to fortify the wall.
ul.li3: 11And you made a reservoir between the walls for the waters of the old pool,
ul.li1: but you did not look to its maker,
ul.li2: and you did not see the one who created it long ago.Literally “its creator from far away”

chapter.p: 12And the Lord, Yahweh of hosts, called on that day

ul.li1: for weeping and mourning,
ul.li2: and for baldness and girding withLiterally “of” sackcloth.
ul.li1: 13But look! Joy and gladness,
ul.li2: the killing of oxenHebrew “ox” and the slaughtering of sheep,
ul.li1: the eating of meat and the drinking of wine!
ul.li2: “Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die!”

chapter.p: 14And it was revealed in my ears by Yahweh of hosts:

ul.li1: “Surely this sin will not be atoned for you until you die!”
ul.li2: says the Lord, Yahweh of hosts.

chapter.p: 15The Lord, Yahweh of hosts, says this:

ul.li1: “Go! Go to this steward, to Shebna,
ul.li2: who is over the house:
ul.li1: 16‘What business do you haveLiterally “to you” here,
ul.li2: and who do you haveLiterally “to you” here,
ul.li1: that you have cut a grave cutting here for yourself,
ul.li2: carving his grave on the height,
a dwelling place for him in the rock?
ul.li1: 17Look! Yahweh is about to really hurlLiterally “hurl a hurling” you, man!
ul.li2: And he is about to grasp you firmly;
ul.li3: 18he will wind a winding tightly around you like a ball, to a wide land.Literally “land broad of sides”
ul.li1: There you shall die,
ul.li2: and there the chariots of your splendor will be,
ul.li1: 19And I will push you from your office,
ul.li2: and he will throw you down from your position.

ul.li1: On that day I will call to my servant, Eliakim son of Hilkiah,
ul.li2: 21and I will clothe him with your tunic,
ul.li1: and I will bind your sash firmly about him,
ul.li2: and I will put your authority into his hand,
ul.li1: and he shall be like a father to the inhabitantsHebrew “inhabitant” of Jerusalem
ul.li2: and to the house of Judah.
ul.li1: 22And I will put the key of the house of David on his shoulder,
ul.li2: and he shall open and no one will be able to shut;
and he shall shut and no one will be able to open.
ul.li1: 23And I will drive him in like a peg into a secure place,
ul.li2: and he will become like a throne of glory to the house of his father.
ul.li1: 24And they will hang all of the heaviness of his father’s house on him,
ul.li2: the offspring and the offshoot,
ul.li1: all of the small vessels,
ul.li2: from the bowls to the jars.Literally “vessels of the bowls to all of the vessels of the jars”

chapter.p: 25On that day, declaresLiterally “declaration of” Yahweh of hosts, the peg that was driven will move away into a secure place, and it will be cut down and fall, and the load that was on her will be cut off. For Yahweh has spoken.’ ”
